node.name: vrrp
node.description: VRRP data at the global level.None

node.name: virtual-routers
node.description: Number of configured virtual routers.None

node.name: interfaces
node.description: Number of interfaces with VRRP configured.None

node.name: statistics
node.description: VRRP global statistics.None

node.name: discontinuity-datetime
node.description:
The time on the most recent occasion at which any one or more of checksum-errors, version-errors, vrid-errors, or ip-ttl-errors suffered a discontinuity.
If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re-initialization of the local management subsystem, then this node contains the time that the local management subsystem re-initialized itself.None

node.name: checksum-errors
node.description: The total number of VRRP packets received with an invalid VRRP checksum value.None

node.name: version-errors
node.description: The total number of VRRP packets received with an unknown or unsupported version number.None

node.name: vrid-errors
node.description: The total number of VRRP packets received with a VRID that is not valid for any virtual router on this router.None

node.name: ip-ttl-errors
node.description: The total number of VRRP packets received by the virtual router with IP TTL (IPv4) or Hop Limit (IPv6) not equal to 255.None

node.name: vrrp-new-master-event
node.description: Notification event for the election of a new VRRP master.None

node.name: master-ip-address
node.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address of the new master.None

node.name: new-master-reason
node.description: Indicates why the virtual router has transitioned to master state.None

node.name: vrrp-protocol-error-event
node.description: Notification event for a VRRP protocol error.None

node.name: protocol-error-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason for the protocol error.None

node.name: vrrp-virtual-router-error-event
node.description: Notification event for an error that happened on a virtual router.None

node.name: interface
node.description: Indicates the interface on which the event has occurred.None

node.name: ip-version
node.description: The error may have happened on either an IPv4 virtual router or an IPv6 virtual router. The information related to a specific IP version is provided by one of the following cases.None

node.name: ipv4
node.description: IPv4.None

node.name: ipv4
node.description: Error information for IPv4.None

node.name: vrid
node.description: Indicates the virtual router on which the event has occurred.None

node.name: ipv6
node.description: IPv6.None

node.name: ipv6
node.description: Error information for IPv6.None

node.name: vrid
node.description: Indicates the virtual router on which the event has occurred.None

node.name: virtual-router-error-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason for the virtual router error.None
